Description: Terracotta mould-made figure of naked man(?). White coating preserved on some areas. Pale red-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine silver and gold mica, quartz, and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably an East Greek relief plaque of Classical Greek or Hellenistic date. See joining fragments NA371, NA372, NA376 and NA813 and NA370 that are similar in style. A Hellensitic East Greek relief plaque from Myrina (but different subject to this) was dated to the 2nd century BC (Mollard-Besques 1963, pl.190 CA 1632; pl.177, MYR 195, MYR 690 ) . Mollard-Besques, S. 1963. Catalogue raisonnédes figurines et reliefs en terre-cuite Grecs et Romains II, Myrina. Paris, Musée National du Louvre.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.351) (Phase 1)
